initial_story: bias triangles represent features in stability diagrams of quantum dot (qd)devices, whose occurrence and property analysis are crucial indicators for spinphysics. nevertheless, challenges associated with quality and availability ofdata as well as the subtlety of physical phenomena of interest have hindered anautomatic and bespoke analysis framework, often still relying (in part) onhuman labelling and verification. we introduce a feature extraction frameworkfor bias triangles, built from unsupervised, segmentation-based computer visionmethods, which facilitates the direct identification and quantification ofphysical properties of the former. thereby, the need for human input or largetraining datasets to inform supervised learning approaches is circumvented,while additionally enabling the automation of pixelwise shape and featurelabeling. in particular, we demonstrate that pauli spin blockade (psb)detection can be conducted effectively, efficiently and without any trainingdata as a direct result of this approach.
stories: Innovative sensors represent anomalies in fault tree diagrams of industrial systems, whose occurrence and property analysis are vital indicators for predictive maintenance. Nevertheless, challenges associated with data quality and availability as well as the complexity of physical phenomena of interest have hindered an automatic and bespoke analysis framework, often still relying (in part) on human expertise and validation. We introduce a sensor anomaly detection framework, built from unsupervised, clustering-based computer vision methods, which facilitates the direct identification and quantification of physical properties of the former. Thereby, the need for human input or large datasets to inform supervised learning approaches is circumvented, while additionally enabling the automation of sensor-level event labeling. In particular, we demonstrate that bearing vibration detection can be conducted effectively, efficiently, and without any training data as a direct result of this approach.

Artificial intelligence empowered medical imaging algorithms decode abnormalities in neural networks of complex biological systems, whose emergence and characterization are crucial indicators for personalized medicine. Notwithstanding, obstacles related to data fidelity and accessibility as well as the intricacy of biological processes of interest have hindered the development of an autonomous and customized analysis platform, often still relying (in part) on human expertise and verification. We present an AI-driven medical imaging framework, constructed from unsupervised, clustering-based deep learning methods, which facilitates the direct identification and quantification of biological properties of the former. Consequently, the need for human input or extensive datasets to inform supervised learning approaches is circumvented, while additionally enabling the automation of image-level event labeling. Specifically, we demonstrate that tumor detection can be conducted effectively, efficiently, and without any training data as a direct result of this approach.

Virtual reality immersive experiences decode hidden patterns in collective human behavior, whose understanding and analysis are crucial indicators for social trend forecasting. Notwithstanding, obstacles related to data noise and user engagement as well as the complexity of social dynamics of interest have hindered the development of an autonomous and contextualized analysis platform, often still relying (in part) on human observation and interpretation. We present a VR-driven social dynamics framework, constructed from unsupervised, clustering-based machine learning methods, which facilitates the direct identification and quantification of social properties of the former. Consequently, the need for human input or extensive datasets to inform supervised learning approaches is circumvented, while additionally enabling the automation of event-level sentiment analysis. Specifically, we demonstrate that social influence can be detected effectively, efficiently, and without any training data as a direct result of this approach.

As a result, the need for extensive practice and adjustment is circumvented, while also empowering the rapid prototyping of novel, autonomous underwater systems with unparalleled oceanic awareness and responsiveness.
